conclusion: Consider the motion of the motorcycle during the stunt.
Motorcycle starts from a height of 0.8m and lands on a horizontal platform with a horizontal velocity of 3 m/s.
Motorcycle smoothly enters a smooth vertical circular track at point A along the tangent of the arc without collision.
Calculate the vertical displacement y using the kinematic equation for vertical motion: y = 0.8 - 5t^2.
Calculate the time of flight by setting the vertical displacement to zero: t = 0.4s.
Calculate the horizontal distance s using the horizontal velocity and time of flight: s = 1.2m.
The horizontal distance s traveled by the person and the car from the platform to point A is 1.2m.
